TopicTitle: Easter eggs are harder to spot

Articles.Content:
I'm having trouble finding the Easter eggs in 0.22. In previous versions I used ISA mapsat, but unfortunately that mod doesn't work (for me?) anymore

In 0.20 and 0.21 I always noticed some shiny dots on the surface while orbiting any random body from high up above, but now in 0.22 it looks like these shiny dots are gone. This combined with the loss of ISA mapsat makes finding anomalies extremely difficult.

Anyone else having this problem? Or maybe some tips to find them more easily?
http://www.kerbalmaps.com/ has all the anomalies with coordinates. I've only ever spotted 1 mun arch on my own, so in my opinion finding them is just as tedious as before.

As far as I know, the recent terrain overhauls have made some go underground, but they're all still there. You could easily find them at www.kerbalmaps.com. Not only does it tell you the location on map view, it tells you the coordinates.Hope this helps!

Thanks a lot guys. Now why didn't Google came up with this? I clearly searched for "KSP easter egg coordinates", but I never found that great map. (In fact, easter egg coordinates are pretty hard to find in general)
I have accidentally stumbled across a Mun Arch and one of the infamous Kerbin Obelisks, With ISA Mapsat gone I kinda got lucky.

I've only encountered one easter egg in .22 so far, and it was strange. I happened to fly past a Mun arch, and I was looking right at it, but at a range of just a few kilometers it simply vanished. Perhaps it was just a graphics glitch.

Check my signature.

So far the Easter eggs are stay-where-they-previously-are.
Have you seen the new S.C.A.N. mapping mod? Makes it super-easy to find anomalies. It's a new mapping mod.
